node.title: 'If we can't get the materials we can't work': Shortages delay build times
node.description: Tradespeople and building suppliers are struggling to get their hands on basic materials such as exterior and interior cladding, causing delays that are doubling some build times.

node.title: 'Massive increase': Rapid rise in home-schooling plans surprises principals
node.description: Principals say some parents are threatening to take their children out of school because of the mask mandate for older primary school children.

node.title: Two men arrested for death threats against Biden
node.description: One man said he was going to "cut the head off the snake in the heart of the nation" and that God had told him to drive to Washington to see the president.

node.title: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to HBO, Hulu, Apple TV+ and More in February
node.description: Every month, streaming services add movies and TV shows to its library. Here are our picks for some of February’s most promising new titles.

node.title: Thousands Told to Evacuate as North Carolina Fertilizer Plant Burns
node.description: The fire broke out on Monday night at the plant in Winston-Salem, where more than 6,000 people within a mile of the plant were told to leave over worries of a possible explosion.

node.title: Border delays and a crash in house prices are the main risks facing the economy - OECD
node.description: The Organisation of Economic Cooperation and Development's survey of the country says the economy is starting to overheat having been supported by government support measures to counter the pandemic. Audio

node.title: Lack of evidence unravels Lois Tolley murder case
node.description: The case against three men charged with the murder of Upper Hutt woman Lois Tolley in 2016 has unravelled due to lack of evidence.

node.title: Westport and Buller prepare for heavy rain, locals warned to avoid non-essential travel
node.description: A heavy rain red warning has been issued for Buller and Westland districts - the most serious weather warning there is. Audio

node.title: MPI consider timing of new cattle barn restrictions
node.description: The Ministry for Primary Industries is consulting on when to bring in new rules that'll impact farmers using barn systems to house dairy cattle.

node.title: Senator Ben Ray Luján undergoes surgery after a stroke
node.description: The 49-year-old senator underwent surgery to ease swelling after he was found to have suffered a stroke in his cerebellum that affected his balance.

node.title: Colleagues isolating as airport worker's positive result announced
node.description: A staff member at Hawke's Bay Airport has tested positive for Covid-19.

node.title: One student dead and one injured after shooting outside of Minnesota school
node.description: Local and state officials are actively investigating​ the incident.

node.title: Post-Covid tourism living on a strategy of hope
node.description: The Detail - There's a new word in tourism of the future - regenerative - and it could be the thing that saves the industry.

node.title: Pence's former chief counsel speaks to House January 6 committee
node.description: Greg Jacob, who reportedly was with the former vice president on January 6, is the latest member of Pence's team to speak with the committee.

node.title: J&J, drug distributors to pay tribes $590M in opioids deal
node.description: Landmark legal settlement offers "measure of justice" to Native American communities hit by opioid epidemic.

node.title: Organisers pull the pin on NZ Golf Open
node.description: The New Zealand Golf Open has again been scrapped due to Covid-19 restrictions.

node.title: NFL's GOAT retires
node.description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback Tom Brady, widely considered the greatest player in NFL history, has announced his retirement.

node.title: Biden taps former Senator Doug Jones to guide Supreme Court pick
node.description: Jones will be responsible for escorting the eventual nominee to meetings with senators in preparation for confirmation hearings.

node.title: Covid-19: Government provides more support for arts and culture sector
node.description: The government is boosting support for the arts sector following the shift to the red traffic light setting.

node.title: Hungarian leader, visiting Moscow, calls Russian demands reasonable and says sanctions are pointless.
node.description: On a friendly visit to Moscow, Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary diverged sharply from his NATO and European Union allies.

node.title: Who is donating to Tasmania's political parties? Good luck finding out
node.description: The latest "disclosure" of Tasmania's political party donations is anything but, with Liberal, Labor and the Greens hiding where they got most of their money from — underlining, yet again, the need for electoral reform, writes Adam Langenberg.

node.title: 'This faceless monster': The 'draining' experience that stops women asking for the help they need
node.description: While men and women experience disability at similar rates, men are more likely to be diagnosed with disabilities that are more straightforward to gain access to the NDIS for.

node.title: Australia's Beijing Winter Olympics campaign starts two days before the opening ceremony
node.description: Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt will take to the ice later today to kick off Australia's Winter Olympics campaign, before the Games' showy opening number.

node.title: The biggest storylines at the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympic Games
node.description: A US star coping with the weight of expectation, a dual Chinese-American teen soaring to new heights, and some speedy Dutch skaters aiming to make history are some of the storylines to watch during this Winter Olympics.

node.title: Reef scientists anxiously eyeing the weather as QLD, WA face potential bleaching events
node.description: Bleaching-free coral reefs are expected to plummet as we head towards 1.5C of warming, as scientists anxiously watch for another bleaching event on the Great Barrier Reef.

node.title: Queensland whistleblowers need better protection, Logan Mayor says
node.description: The Mayor of Logan Darren Power says he understands why "people look the other way" instead of reporting corruption.

node.title: Should aged care workers be paid more? The union is hoping the Fair Work Commission says yes
node.description: The federal government has announced cash payments to try to retain aged care workers, but at the moment the Fair Work Commission is considering a case for substantially increasing wages. This is where it's up to so far.

node.title: 'It's a lot of money lost': How you can protect your super with the stock market plunging and interest rates rising
node.description: Australians have nervously watched their super balances plummet in recent weeks off the back of stock market falls. But there are steps people can take to protect their retirement nest egg.

node.title: Interest rates are tipped to rise later this year. So, is it time to fix your home loan?
node.description: While the Reserve Bank may have kept the official cash rate on hold this week, economists are predicting rates to rise before the end of the year.

node.title: Socceroos' hopes of World Cup qualification take a hit in Oman
node.description: The Socceroos are unlikely to secure automatic qualification to the World Cup after Oman secures a draw with a late penalty.
